Flagging Items

To highlight specific items (except audit entries) on the upper pane, you can add a flag to them. For example, you might wish to flag items related to a particular customer request.

Flags are set, viewed, and removed by the user who created them. If an item has been flagged, the Flag field displays Yes and a blue flag. If an item is not flagged, the Flag field displays No. To display flagged items, the upper pane must be in list format.

To flag an item:

  1. Select a folder from the folder hierarchy.

  2. Select any component tab except Audit.

  3. Select the item you want to flag.

  4. Select Flag from the component or context menu. If the items in the upper pane appear in tree format, switch to the list format to display the flagged items.

    5. Note:  If the Flag field does not appear, right-click a column header, and select Show Fields from the context menu. Select the Flag field from the Available fields list, click Add, then click OK.

To clear a flag:

  1. Select a folder from the folder hierarchy.

  2. Select any component tab except Audit. If the items in the upper pane appear in tree format, switch to the list format to display the flagged items.

  3. Select the item from which you wish to remove the flag.

  4. Select Remove Flag from the component or context menu.

Tip: Use the following shortcut keys: Ctrl + F2 to flag an item; Ctrl + Shift+F2 to remove a flag from an item
